intro: Sceptridium alabamense, commonly known as the Alabama beardtongue, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has small, lance-shaped leaves. It is a herbaceous perennial that blooms in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
